title: 7 Brides Show How To Be Not Scared Of A Gold Lehenga
text:
facebook 925 SHARES 
In 2017, it’s well-established that red isn’t the only signature colour for brides. A fresh case has been made by pastels, black is no longer relegated to the ranks of no-nos and unexpected hues like lilacs have made a definitive appearance. Well, there’s another ultra-glamorous, seriously-shiny hue that is celeb-approved and oh-so-gorgeous – it’s gold we are talking about. Most of you heart this colour but fear picking the hue for your big day. These 7 brides, drenched in gold, show you why picking the hue could be the best wedding decision you ever made. 1. Pick a shade of pink to go with your lehenga and twirl about your photoshoot. A photo posted by Ashwin & Jhalak (@shadesphotographyindia) on Dec 31, 2016 at 1:54am PST 2. Wear a gajra in your hair to balance all that gold A photo posted by sutra snapperz (@sutrasnapperz) on Nov 20, 2016 at 8:58pm PST 3. Introduce contrast through your jewellery. Trade your gold jewellery for royal emeralds or flaming rubies. A photo posted by sutra snapperz (@sutrasnapperz) on Jan 29, 2016 at 9:38am PST 4. Go against the rule and sport a white-dupatta with your glimmering outfit. #karansidhuphotography #indianweddings #candidweddingphotography #candidphotography #indianweddingphotographer #weddingphotoinspiration #weddingphotojournalism #wedmegood #weddingplz #bride #indianbride #beautiful #sodelhi #groom #brideandgroom #naughty A photo posted by Karan Sidhu (@karansidhuphotography) on Nov 17, 2016 at 2:11am PST 5. If you have the heart for it, skip on jewellery altogether and let the 3D floral embroidery do all the shinning, like this bride. LOVE IN FULL BLOOM! Esha Babbar is Solid Gold in a 3D Lotus Ghagra by #AbuJaniSandeepKhosla. #AJSKBride #Bride #beautiful #gorgeous #stunning #couple #celebrations #abujani #sandeepkhosla #fashion #designers #love #ghagra #lehenga #Indianwear #traditional A photo posted by Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla (@abujanisandeepkhosla) on Nov 18, 2016 at 6:27am PST 6. Experiment with a deeper-hued (preferably wine) hem to nail all the bridal portraits. Use the same colour for your lips. A photo posted by Sabyasachi Mukherjee (@sabyasachiofficial) on Dec 19, 2016 at 5:40am PST 7. Embrace head-to-sequin like a gold-goddess and accessories it with all-things gold.
